alert.note: Alert for Marshall; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 30 at 9:56PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Marshall, Rutherford, southeastern Williamson and Bedford Counties through 1045 PM CDT... At 956 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Spring Hill to near Ardmore. Movement was northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Murfreesboro, Shelbyville, Lewisburg, Smyrna, La Vergne, Walterhill, Chapel Hill, Wartrace, Eagleville, Bell Buckle, Lascassas, Christiana, Raus, Fosterville, Triune, Rover, Belfast, Deason, Rockvale and Farmington. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 between mile markers 67 and 95. Interstate 840 between mile markers 41 and 64. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for Middle Tennessee.
